review_title: Awful benefits, especially for a hospital
job_title: Social Worker in Show Low, AZ
pros: Good Location in a Nice Community
cons: Summit has recently reduced their already threadbare benefits taking away 1% of retirement match, 40 HOURS per year of vacation, and much more. There are only a couple of paid holidays per year, but you still have to put in a request for them off. I have never seen a more confusing paycheck stub. They've messed up my pay a couple of times, never responded to my calls/emails, then just adjusted my next check with no explanation. I still don't know what they did. I have worked at several facilities across the state and the benefits Summit offers are the worst I've ever experienced. The insurance is pretty much non-existent, with super high deductibles and Walgreens (across the street!) doesn't even accept it. I would expect better from a healthcare provider and the largest private employer in the county. They make you interview over and over for the same position, a simple transfer, etc. It's a crazy, mismanaged workplace.

job_title: in Show Low, AZ
pros: Small town feel with this community hospital.  Trying to be progressive with the latest in equipment.
cons: Very, Very clickish. A lot of the employees are born and raised in this area and hard to fit in with the group.  Some of the managers will stab you in the back if it will make them look better.

job_title: Physician Assistant in Show Low, AZ
pros: good company culture, nice work environment, good ability to move upward within organization. Nice surroundings, new facility, excellent benefits, good incentive to do continued education.
cons: Lower salaries, small town location does not always attract professionals used to living in a lager city which provides more activities, services, and goods.
